p: Thymus serrulatus Hochst. ex Benth (Lamiaceae), a much-branched perennial subshrub that grows in the Afromontane and Afroalpine zones of Ethiopia and Eritrea ( Damtie and Mekonnen, 2015). In Ethiopia, it is found in the northern highlands of Semien Shoa, Tigray, and Wollo areas ( Melka et al., 2016, Damtie et al., 2018). It is known by the local communities as Tosign in Amhara and Tesni/Thasne in Tigray region of Ethiopia ( Damtie et al., 2017).
